measured_by: signal-detection sensitivity d′ across set sizes
justification: The text states that “the sample-size model predicts that d′ for an m-item display will be proportional to d′ for a single-item display… and has been used as a measure of VWM capacity”.

measured_by: inverse circular standard deviation (1/CSD) of recall errors
justification: When describing how they quantified the set-size effect the authors write that they used “1/CSD, the reciprocal of the circular standard deviation of the JP distribution,” as their index of memory precision.

Memory variability is formalised with the three-parameter Jones-Pewsey distribution; the paper notes that its “precision parameter, κµ, represents tangential… variation of the drift rate” and is used to characterise how memory precision changes with set size.

measured_by: drift-rate norm ν of the Circular Diffusion Model
justification: The authors explain that “Each stimulus condition is represented by a distribution of drift rates with a mean drift rate (drift-rate norm) ν, which determines how rapidly, on average, evidence accumulates in the CDM.”
construct: Rate of evidence accumulation in decision making
